Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Match

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Observable<ServerEvent>
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Match
All Implemented Interfaces:
Model
public class Match
extends Observable<ServerEvent>
implements Model
Core class of the game logic in the model. This class holds the list of the active players. It initializes everything necessary to start a game and to follow its evolution.

The basic idea is to track an user decisions and to communicate to other players the changes sending information through ModelUpdate.

    • selectWorker

      public void selectWorker​(int x, int y) throws InvalidWorkerSelectionException
      Worker whom a Player decides to perform an action with. Only the coordinates are passed; if the choice is not valid an exception is thrown
      Specified by:
      selectWorker in interface Model
      Parameters:
      x - expected Worker x coordinate
      y - expected Worker y coordinate
      Throws:
      InvalidWorkerSelectionException - thrown whether the worker is not in the specified position, the worker does not belong to the current player or such worker has no available moves

    • placeWorkers

      public void placeWorkers​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2) throws WorkerBadPlacementException
      This method has to be called at the begging of the game by each player to place their workers on the Board.

      The player selects four coordinates on which his two workers will be placed; if a positioning is not valid, the player will have to reenter all the four coordinates again

      Throws:
      WorkerBadPlacementException - Exception called when the coordinates are out of bound, they are the same, or a Tile is already occupied by a precedent player's worker

    • findWinner

      public Player findWinner()
      Returns:
      The winning Player

    • checkWinner

      public int checkWinner()
      Returns the index of the winning player, if there is one
      Specified by:
      checkWinner in interface Model
      Returns:
      index of the winning player

    • checkLoser

      public java.lang.Boolean checkLoser()
      This method checks if a player has lost; if so that player is removed from players, his workers are removed from the Board and the other players are notified. If only one Player is left, he is declared the winner
      Specified by:
      checkLoser in interface Model
      Returns:
      Returns true if a player lost after eliminating him

    • setAction

      public void setAction​(Action action) throws InvalidActionException
      Action chosen by a client
      Specified by:
      setAction in interface Model
      Parameters:
      action - one of the possible actions from the enumeration Action i.e. Action.BUILD, Action.BUILDDOME, Action.MOVE or Action.END
      Throws:
      InvalidActionException - The action is not present among the current player's actions

    • setDivinityMap

      public void setDivinityMap​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Divinity> divinities)
      Called at the beginning of a match to keep track of all the available divinities. The divinities's names are loaded from an xml file and they are put in a map with the corresponding class.
      Specified by:
      setDivinityMap in interface Model
      Parameters:
      divinities - Map of divinities and their class

    • loadPlayerDivinity

      public void loadPlayerDivinity​(java.lang.String divinityName) throws InvalidDivinitySelectionEvent
      Sets a player's divinity assigning the divinity to a player, retrieving the divinity's class from the map.
      Parameters:
      divinityName - Name of the divinity to be loaded
      Throws:
      InvalidDivinitySelectionEvent - divinity not found

    • divinityInitialization

      public void divinityInitialization​(java.lang.String divName) throws InvalidDivinitySelectionEvent
      Sets a player's divinity calling another method to load it from the map of divinities. Then it advances to the next player.
      Specified by:
      divinityInitialization in interface Model
      Parameters:
      divName - name of the divinity chosen by the player
      Throws:
      InvalidDivinitySelectionEvent - thrown if no such divinity is found

    • workerPlacementInitialization

      public void workerPlacementInitialization​(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2) throws WorkerBadPlacementException
      Positions a player's workers on the board. The turn passes to the next player until the player is reached and after their selection, the game begins.
      Specified by:
      workerPlacementInitialization in interface Model
      Parameters:
      x1 - Worker's coordinates
      y1 - Worker's coordinates
      x2 - Worker's coordinates
      y2 - Worker's coordinates
      Throws:
      WorkerBadPlacementException - The player tried to position a worker on another one
